Package it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.InteractiveComponents

Class LobbyCreator

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.Component
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.LiveComponent
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.InteractiveComponents.InteractiveComponent
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.InteractiveComponents.LobbyCreator
public class LobbyCreator extends InteractiveComponent
Represents an interactive component responsible for guiding the user through the process of creating a game lobby. It manages the input for setting the lobby name and the target number of users, validates the inputs, and sends a packet to start the lobby creation process. This component handles state transitions and displays appropriate messages for input validation errors and status updates during the lobby creation process.

  • Constructor Details

    • LobbyCreator

      public LobbyCreator()
      Initializes a LobbyCreator instance with the necessary attributes and prepares it to guide the user through the process of creating a game lobby. The LobbyCreator interacts with the client-side model to manage lobby creation requests and handles input validation for setting the lobby name and the target number of users. It observes changes in the lobby creation process and updates its state accordingly.

  • Method Details

    • handleInput

      public InteractiveComponentReturns handleInput(String input)
      Handles user input for creating a game lobby. This method processes the input to set the lobby name and the target number of users, and sends a packet to start the lobby. It also manages state transitions based on input validation.
      Overrides:
      handleInput in class InteractiveComponent
      Parameters:
      input - the user input string to be processed
      Returns:
      the state of the input handling process as an InteractiveComponentReturns enum

    • getKeyword

      public String getKeyword()
      Returns the keyword associated with this interactive component. The keyword is used to determine which component should handle the input when there are multiple interactive component in the same view state.
      Specified by:
      getKeyword in class InteractiveComponent
      Returns:
      The keyword associated with this interactive component.

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      This method returns an empty string as there is no specific description associated with the LobbyCreator component.
      Specified by:
      getDescription in class InteractiveComponent
      Returns:
      an empty string

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints the current state of the lobby creation process to the console. It handles various scenarios such as displaying errors for invalid player numbers or name conflicts, prompting for lobby name and number of users, and indicating waiting states for server responses.

      The method also checks for the presence of errors related to lobby name availability and updates the input counter based on the state of nameAlreadyTaken. It invokes the superclass print method to print any inherited messages.

      Overrides:
      print in class InteractiveComponent

    • cleanObserved

      public void cleanObserved()
      This method overrides the cleanObserved method in InteractiveComponent but does not implement any specific cleaning actions for observed components within the LobbyCreator.
      Specified by:
      cleanObserved in class LiveComponent

    • refreshObserved

      public void refreshObserved()
